Definition.Document:
Drift Detection and Modeling - Autoclave

Autoclaves are integral in the sterilization process for aseptic processing parts, drug substances, and other sterile materials. The vacuum test is critical in ensuring the the autoclave chamber is able to achieve a full vacuum and remove all of the air from the system (air prevents true sterilization). There are standards, like EN 13060, that set leak rate limits for the vacuum test pressure hold tests (PHT).

Seeq can be leveraged to build a reference profile around to the PHT operation, which can in turn be monitored real time and projected into the future to identify potential failures. 

Operation Identification

Add the pressure, temperature, and operation data. Use this to identify point of interest, build golden reference profiles, and model the drift over time.

  • Starting Point

Identify the Vacuum Test cycles. The PHT lull period will be focused on to detect abnormal pressure changes which could indicate potential PHT failures and subsequently equipment issues. 

  • Complete Vacuum Test
  • PHT Test
    • Typically the maximum allowable DP over this period is ~2kPa during the hold period. This threshold can vary depending on the autoclave vendor and the specific validation that was performed around the equipment.

Ideal PHT Selection

Select the ideal PHTs from historical data to be used to as training periods to create statistical reference profiles. We can overlay the PHT capsules to compare the selected clean vs other cycles.

  • Clean PHT Selection
  • Chain View

Reference Profiles

Build the statistical reference profiles using the ideal historical PHT datasets as training periods. The profiles here use a +/-4 Std. Dev. We will also include an average profile for reference.

  • Upper Pressure Limit
  • Lower Pressure Limit
  • Average

Monitor for PHT Deviations

Detect any deviations during the PHT using the upper and lower statistical limits as the boundaries. This can be useful to detect early signs of equipment failures that would not otherwise be detected by the DP limit during the PHT.

  • PHT Deviations

Model Pressure Drift: Predict Failure

Create a prediction model of the pressure drift during the PHT over time. Project the model into the future to help identify an approximate time when the PHT is expected to fail the DP threshold of 2kPa. The DP threshold can vary depending on the equipment manufacture and the validation.

  • PHT period DP
  • Modeled PHT DP
  • Projected PHT DP
  • Detect DP limit exceeded

Notifications

One the PHT deviations and or the drift model is configured email notifications can be configured to notify the end user of an event. This can be done by pushing the information back to PI AF and utilizing the email/text notifications there. Additionally, Seeq Data Lab can be used to send out email notifications.

The vacuum test is critical in ensuring the the autoclave chamber is able to achieve a full vacuum and remove all of the air from the system (air prevents true sterilization). Bring in the pressure, temperature, and operation data. We will use this to identify point of interest, build golden reference profiles, and model the drift over time.
